# Introduction
`DESeqPLUS` is an R package designed to simplify the visualization of RNA-seq data stored in **DESeqDataSet** objects. This vignette demonstrates the three main functions currently available:

1. `qcPlot()` – Quick quality control plots.
2. `pcaPlot()` – Principal component analysis plots.
3. `volcanoPlot()` – Volcano plots of differentially expressed genes.

We will use the **airway** dataset for demonstration.

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(DESeqPLUS)
library(DESeq2)
library(airway)
data(airway)
dds <- DESeqDataSet(airway, design = ~ dex)
```
# 1. Quality Control Plots: `qcPlot()`
The `qcPlot()` function produces two plots: total library size per sample and distribution of log-transformed counts. This helps to detect samples with unusually low read counts or other quality issues.

```{r}
qcPlot(dds, title = "Airway QC Summary")
```

# 2. PCA Plot: `pcaPlot()`
The `pcaPlot()` function performs principal component analysis on the most variable genes (default 500) to explore sample clustering and detect potential outliers. PCA is calculated on variance-stabilized counts.
```{r}
pcaPlot(dds, ntop = 500, title = "Airway PCA")
```

# 3. Volcano Plot: `volcanoPlot()`
The `volcanoPlot()` function visualizes differential expression results from a DESeq2 analysis. The x-axis shows log2 fold changes, and the y-axis shows -log10 adjusted p-values, highlighting significantly up- or down-regulated genes.

```{r}
dds <- DESeq(dds)
res <- results(dds, alpha = 0.1)
volcanoPlot(res, title = "Airway Volcano Plot")
```
